22 /*!*****************************************************************************
23  * \file ni_device_api.c
24  *
25  * \brief Public definitions for operating NETINT video processing devices for
26  * video processing
27  ******************************************************************************/
28 
29 #if __linux__ || __APPLE__
30 #define _GNU_SOURCE //O_DIRECT is Linux-specific. One must define _GNU_SOURCE to obtain its definitions
31 #if __linux__
32 #include <linux/types.h>
33 #endif
34 #include <unistd.h>
35 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
36 #include <sys/mman.h>
37 #include <sys/types.h>
38 #include <sys/stat.h>
39 #include <sys/time.h>
40 #include <fcntl.h>
41 #include <errno.h>
42 #include <semaphore.h>
43 #include <limits.h>
44 #include <unistd.h>
45 #include <signal.h>
46 #include <poll.h>
47 #endif
48 
49 #include <stdint.h>
50 #include <string.h>
51 #include <stdio.h>
52 #include <stdlib.h>
53 #include <stdint.h>
54 #include <sys/stat.h>
55 #include "inttypes.h"
56 #include "ni_device_api.h"
57 #include "ni_device_api_priv.h"
58 #include "ni_nvme.h"
59 #include "ni_util.h"
60 #include "ni_rsrc_api.h"
61 #include "ni_rsrc_priv.h"
62 #include "ni_lat_meas.h"
63 #ifndef _WIN32
64 #include "ni_p2p_ioctl.h"
65 #endif

67 const char *const g_xcoder_preset_names[NI_XCODER_PRESET_NAMES_ARRAY_LEN] = {
68  NI_XCODER_PRESET_NAME_DEFAULT, NI_XCODER_PRESET_NAME_CUSTOM, 0};
69 const char *const g_xcoder_log_names[NI_XCODER_LOG_NAMES_ARRAY_LEN] = {
70  NI_XCODER_LOG_NAME_NONE,
71  NI_XCODER_LOG_NAME_ERROR,
72  NI_XCODER_LOG_NAME_WARN,
73  NI_XCODER_LOG_NAME_INFO,
74  NI_XCODER_LOG_NAME_DEBUG,
75  NI_XCODER_LOG_NAME_FULL,
76  0};
77 #if __linux__ || __APPLE__
78 static struct stat g_nvme_stat = { 0 };
79 #endif
80 
81 /*!*****************************************************************************
82  * \brief Allocate and initialize a new ni_session_context_t struct
83  *
84  *
85  * \return On success returns a valid pointer to newly allocated context
86  * On failure returns NULL
87  ******************************************************************************/
88 ni_session_context_t *ni_device_session_context_alloc_init(void)
89 {
90  ni_session_context_t *p_ctx = NULL;
91 
92  p_ctx = malloc(sizeof(ni_session_context_t));
93  if (!p_ctx)
94  {
95  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
96  "ERROR: %s() Failed to allocate memory for session context\n",
97  __func__);
98  } else
99  {
100  if (ni_device_session_context_init(p_ctx) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
101  {
102  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Failed to init session context\n",
103  __func__);
104  ni_device_session_context_free(p_ctx);
105  return NULL;
106  }
107  }
108  return p_ctx;
109 }
110 
111 /*!*****************************************************************************
112  * \brief Free previously allocated session context
113  *
114  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to an already allocated ni_session_context_t
115  * struct
116  *
117  ******************************************************************************/
118 void ni_device_session_context_free(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx)
119 {
120  if (p_ctx)
121  {
122  ni_device_session_context_clear(p_ctx);
123 #ifdef MEASURE_LATENCY
124  if (p_ctx->frame_time_q)
125  {
126  ni_lat_meas_q_destroy(p_ctx->frame_time_q);
127  }
128 #endif
129  // cppcheck-suppress uselessAssignmentPtrArg
130  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx);
131  }
132 }
133 
134 /*!*****************************************************************************
135  * \brief Initialize already allocated session context to a known state
136  *
137  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to an already allocated ni_session_context_t
138  * struct
139  * \return On success
140  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
141  * On failure
142  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
143  * NI_RETCODE_FAILURE
144  ******************************************************************************/
145 ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_context_init(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx)
146 {
147  if (!p_ctx)
148  {
149  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
150  }
151 
152  memset(p_ctx, 0, sizeof(ni_session_context_t));
153 
154  // Xcoder thread mutex init
155  if (ni_pthread_mutex_init(&p_ctx->mutex))
156  {
157  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): init xcoder_mutex fail, return\n",
158  __func__);
159  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
160  }
161  p_ctx->pext_mutex = &p_ctx->mutex; //used exclusively for hwdl
162 
163  // low delay send/recv sync init
164  if (ni_pthread_mutex_init(&p_ctx->low_delay_sync_mutex))
165  {
166  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
167  "ERROR %s(): init xcoder_low_delay_sync_mutex fail return\n",
168  __func__);
169  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
170  }
171  if (ni_pthread_cond_init(&p_ctx->low_delay_sync_cond, NULL))
172  {
173  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
174  "ERROR %s(): init xcoder_low_delay_sync_cond fail return\n",
175  __func__);
176  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
177  }
178 
179  // Init the max IO size to be invalid
180  p_ctx->max_nvme_io_size = NI_INVALID_IO_SIZE;
181  p_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
182  p_ctx->session_run_state = SESSION_RUN_STATE_NORMAL;
183  p_ctx->blk_io_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
184  p_ctx->device_handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
185  p_ctx->hw_id = NI_INVALID_HWID;
186  p_ctx->event_handle = NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE;
187  p_ctx->thread_event_handle = NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE;
188  p_ctx->xcoder_state = NI_XCODER_IDLE_STATE;
189  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread = (ni_pthread_t){0};
190  p_ctx->keep_alive_timeout = NI_DEFAULT_KEEP_ALIVE_TIMEOUT;
191  p_ctx->decoder_low_delay = 0;
192  p_ctx->low_delay_sync_flag = 0;
193  p_ctx->async_mode = 0;
194 #ifdef MY_SAVE
195  p_ctx->debug_write_ptr = NULL;
196  p_ctx->debug_write_index_ptr = NULL;
197  p_ctx->debug_write_sent_size = 0;
198 #endif
199 
200 #ifdef MEASURE_LATENCY
201  p_ctx->frame_time_q = (void *)ni_lat_meas_q_create(2000);
202  p_ctx->prev_read_frame_time = 0;
203 #endif
204  return NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
205 }
206 
207 /*!*****************************************************************************
208  * \brief Clear already allocated session context
209  *
210  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to an already allocated ni_session_context_t
211  *
212  *
213  ******************************************************************************/
214 void ni_device_session_context_clear(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx)
215 {
216  ni_pthread_mutex_destroy(&p_ctx->mutex);
217  ni_pthread_mutex_destroy(&p_ctx->low_delay_sync_mutex);
218  ni_pthread_cond_destroy(&p_ctx->low_delay_sync_cond);
219 }
220 
221 /*!*****************************************************************************
222  * \brief Create event and return event handle if successful (Windows only)
223  *
224  * \return On success returns a event handle
225  * On failure returns NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE
226  ******************************************************************************/
227 ni_event_handle_t ni_create_event(void)
228 {
229 #ifdef _WIN32
230  ni_event_handle_t event_handle = NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE;
231 
232  // Input-0 determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by the child process.If lpEventAttributes is NULL, this handle cannot be inherited.
233  // Input-1 specifies whether the event object is created to be restored manually or automatically.If set to FALSE, when a thread waits for an event signal, the system automatically restores the event state to a non-signaled state.
234  // Input-2 specifies the initial state of the event object.If TRUE, the initial state is signaled;Otherwise, no signal state.
235  // Input-3 If the lpName is NULL, a nameless event object is created.。
236  event_handle = CreateEvent(NULL, FALSE, FALSE, NULL);
237  if (event_handle == NULL)
238  {
239  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() create event failed\n",
240  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
241  return NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE;
242  }
243  return event_handle;
244 #else
245  return NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE;
246 #endif
247 }
248 
249 /*!*****************************************************************************
250  * \brief Close event and release resources (Windows only)
251  *
252  * \return NONE
253  *
254  ******************************************************************************/
255 void ni_close_event(ni_event_handle_t event_handle)
256 {
257  if ( NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE == event_handle )
258  {
259  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Warning %s: null parameter passed %x\n", __func__,
260  event_handle);
261  return;
262  }
263 
264  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
265 
266 #ifdef _WIN32
267  BOOL retval;
268  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): closing %p\n", event_handle);
269 
270  retval = CloseHandle(event_handle);
271  if (FALSE == retval)
272  {
273  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s(): closing event_handle %p failed\n",
274  NI_ERRNO, __func__, event_handle);
275  }
276  else
277  {
278  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): device %p closed successfuly\n", __func__,
279  event_handle);
280  }
281 #else
282  int err = 0;
283  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): closing %d\n", __func__, event_handle);
284  err = close(event_handle);
285  if (err)
286  {
287  char error_message[100] = {'\0'};
288  char unknown_error_message[20] = {'\0'};
289  sprintf(error_message, "ERROR: %s(): ", __func__);
290  switch (err)
291  {
292  case EBADF:
293  strcat(error_message, "EBADF\n");
294  break;
295  case EINTR:
296  strcat(error_message, "EINTR\n");
297  break;
298  case EIO:
299  strcat(error_message, "EIO\n");
300  break;
301  default:
302  sprintf(unknown_error_message, "Unknown error %d\n", err);
303  strcat(error_message, unknown_error_message);
304  }
305  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", error_message);
306  }
307 #endif
308  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
309 }
310 
311 /*!*****************************************************************************
312  * \brief Open device and return device device_handle if successful
313  *
314  * \param[in] p_dev Device name represented as c string. ex: "/dev/nvme0"
315  * \param[out] p_max_io_size_out Maximum IO Transfer size supported, could be
316  * NULL
317  *
318  * \return On success returns a device device_handle
319  * On failure returns NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE
320  ******************************************************************************/
321 ni_device_handle_t ni_device_open(const char * p_dev, uint32_t * p_max_io_size_out)
322 {
323 #ifdef _WIN32
324  DWORD retval;
325  HANDLE device_handle;
326 
327  if (!p_dev)
328  {
329  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: passed parameters are null!, return\n");
330  return NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
331  }
332 
333  if (p_max_io_size_out != NULL && *p_max_io_size_out == NI_INVALID_IO_SIZE)
334  {
335  // For now, we just use it to allocate p_leftover buffer
336  // NI_MAX_PACKET_SZ is big enough
337  *p_max_io_size_out = NI_MAX_PACKET_SZ;
338  }
339 
340  device_handle = CreateFile(p_dev, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE,
341  FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE, NULL,
342  OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_FLAG_NO_BUFFERING, NULL);
343 
344  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s() device_name: %s", __func__, p_dev);
345  if (INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE == device_handle)
346  {
347  retval = GetLastError();
348  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to open %s, retval %d \n", p_dev, retval);
349  } else
350  {
351  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Found NVME Controller at %s \n", p_dev);
352  }
353 
354  return device_handle;
355 #else
356  int retval = -1;
357  ni_device_handle_t fd = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
358 
359  if (!p_dev)
360  {
361  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: passed parameters are null!, return\n");
362  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
363  }
364 
365  if (p_max_io_size_out != NULL && *p_max_io_size_out == NI_INVALID_IO_SIZE)
366  {
367  #if __linux__
368  *p_max_io_size_out = ni_get_kernel_max_io_size(p_dev);
369  #elif __APPLE__
370  *p_max_io_size_out = MAX_IO_TRANSFER_SIZE;
371  #endif
372  }
373 
374  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: opening regular-io enabled %s\n", __func__,
375  p_dev);
376  //O_SYNC is added to ensure that data is written to the card when the pread/pwrite function returns
377  #if __linux__
378  //O_DIRECT is added to ensure that data can be sent directly to the card instead of to cache memory
379  fd = open(p_dev, O_RDWR | O_SYNC | O_DIRECT);
380  #elif __APPLE__
381  //O_DIRECT isn't available, so instead we use F_NOCACHE below
382  fd = open(p_dev, O_RDWR | O_SYNC);
383  #endif
384 
385  if (fd < 0)
386  {
387  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: open() failed on %s\n", p_dev);
388  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() failed!\n", __func__);
389  fd = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
390  LRETURN;
391  }
392 
393  #if __APPLE__
394  //F_NOCACHE is set to ensure that data can be sent directly to the card instead of to cache memory
395  retval = fcntl(fd, F_NOCACHE, 1);
396  if (retval < 0)
397  {
398  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: fnctl() failed on %s\n", p_dev);
399  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: ni_device_open() failed!\n");
400  close(fd);
401  fd = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
402  LRETURN;
403  }
404  #endif
405 
406  retval = fstat(fd, &g_nvme_stat);
407  if (retval < 0)
408  {
409  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: fstat() failed on %s\n", p_dev);
410  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() failed!\n", __func__);
411  close(fd);
412  fd = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
413  LRETURN;
414  }
415 
416  if (!S_ISCHR(g_nvme_stat.st_mode) && !S_ISBLK(g_nvme_stat.st_mode))
417  {
418  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s is not a block or character device\n",
419  p_dev);
420  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() failed!\n", __func__);
421  close(fd);
422  fd = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
423  LRETURN;
424  }
425 
426  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: success, fd=%d\n", __func__, fd);
427 
428 END:
429 
430  return fd;
431 #endif
432 }
433 
434 /*!*****************************************************************************
435  * \brief Close device and release resources
436  *
437  * \param[in] device_handle Device handle obtained by calling ni_device_open()
438  *
439  * \return NONE
440  *
441  ******************************************************************************/
442 void ni_device_close(ni_device_handle_t device_handle)
443 {
444  if ( NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE == device_handle )
445  {
446  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s: null parameter passed %x\n", __func__,
447  device_handle);
448  return;
449  }
450 
451  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
452 
453 #ifdef _WIN32
454  BOOL retval;
455 
456  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): closing %p\n", __func__, device_handle);
457 
458  retval = CloseHandle(device_handle);
459  if (FALSE == retval)
460  {
461  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
462  "ERROR: %s(): closing device device_handle %p failed, error: %d\n",
463  __func__, device_handle, NI_ERRNO);
464  }
465  else
466  {
467  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): device %p closed successfuly\n", __func__,
468  device_handle);
469  }
470 #else
471  int err = 0;
472  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): closing %d\n", __func__, device_handle);
473  err = close(device_handle);
474  if (err)
475  {
476  char error_message[100] = {'\0'};
477  char unknown_error_message[20] = {'\0'};
478  sprintf(error_message, "ERROR: %s(): ", __func__);
479  switch (err)
480  {
481  case EBADF:
482  strcat(error_message, "EBADF\n");
483  break;
484  case EINTR:
485  strcat(error_message, "EINTR\n");
486  break;
487  case EIO:
488  strcat(error_message, "EIO\n");
489  break;
490  default:
491  sprintf(unknown_error_message, "Unknown error %d\n", err);
492  strcat(error_message, unknown_error_message);
493  }
494  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", error_message);
495  }
496 #endif
497  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
498 }
499 
500 /*!*****************************************************************************
501  * \brief Query device and return device capability structure
502  *
503  * \param[in] device_handle Device handle obtained by calling ni_device_open
504  * \param[in] p_cap Pointer to a caller allocated ni_device_capability_t
505  * struct
506  * \return On success
507  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
508  * On failure
509  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
510  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
511  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
512  ******************************************************************************/
513 ni_retcode_t ni_device_capability_query(ni_device_handle_t device_handle, ni_device_capability_t* p_cap)
514 {
515  ni_nvme_result_t nvme_result = 0;
516  void * p_buffer = NULL;
517  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
518  ni_event_handle_t event_handle = NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE;
519 
520  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
521 
522  if ( (NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE == device_handle) || (!p_cap) )
523  {
524  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s(): passed parameters are null, return\n",
525  __func__);
526  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
527  LRETURN;
528  }
529 
530  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE),
531  NI_NVME_IDENTITY_CMD_DATA_SZ))
532  {
533  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate buffer.\n",
534  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
535  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
536  LRETURN;
537  }
538 
539  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_NVME_IDENTITY_CMD_DATA_SZ);
540 
541  uint32_t ui32LBA = IDENTIFY_DEVICE_R;
542  if (ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(device_handle, event_handle, p_buffer, NI_NVME_IDENTITY_CMD_DATA_SZ, ui32LBA) < 0)
543  {
544  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
545  LRETURN;
546  }
547 
548  ni_populate_device_capability_struct(p_cap, p_buffer);
549 
550 END:
551 
552  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
553  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): retval: %d\n", __func__, retval);
554 
555  return retval;
556 }
557 
558 /*!*****************************************************************************
559  * \brief Open a new device session depending on the device_type parameter
560  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER opens decoding session
561  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER opens encoding session
562  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER opens scaling session
563  *
564  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
565  * ni_session_context_t struct
566  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER,
567  * or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
568  * \return On success
569  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
570  * On failure
571  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
572  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
573  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
574  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
575  ******************************************************************************/
576 ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_open(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
577  ni_device_type_t device_type)
578 {
579  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
580  ni_device_pool_t *p_device_pool = NULL;
581  ni_nvme_result_t nvme_result = {0};
582  ni_device_context_t *p_device_context = NULL;
583  ni_device_info_t *p_dev_info = NULL;
584  ni_device_info_t dev_info = { 0 };
586  ni_device_context_t *rsrc_ctx = NULL;
587  int i = 0;
588  int rc = 0;
589  int num_coders = 0;
590  int least_model_load = 0;
591  int least_instance = 0;
592  int guid = -1;
593  uint32_t num_sw_instances = 0;
594  int user_handles = false;
595  ni_lock_handle_t lock = NI_INVALID_LOCK_HANDLE;
596  ni_device_handle_t handle = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
597  ni_device_handle_t handle1 = NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE;
598  // For none nvme block device we just need to pass in dummy
599  uint32_t dummy_io_size = 0;
600  ni_session_context_t p_session_context;
601  ni_device_type_t query_type = device_type;
602 
603  if (!p_ctx)
604  {
605  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null, return\n",
606  __func__);
607  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
608  }
609 
610  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
611  p_ctx->xcoder_state |= NI_XCODER_OPEN_STATE;
612 
613  ni_device_session_context_init(&p_session_context);
614 
615  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID != p_ctx->session_id)
616  {
617  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: trying to overwrite existing session, "
618  "device_type %d, session id %d\n",
619  device_type, p_ctx->session_id);
620  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
621  LRETURN;
622  }
623 
624  p_ctx->p_hdr_buf = NULL;
625  p_ctx->hdr_buf_size = 0;
626 
627  p_ctx->roi_side_data_size = p_ctx->nb_rois = 0;
628  p_ctx->av_rois = NULL;
629  p_ctx->roi_map = NULL;
630  p_ctx->p_master_display_meta_data = NULL;
631 
632  p_ctx->enc_change_params = NULL;
633 
634  p_ctx->target_bitrate = -1;
635  p_ctx->force_idr_frame = 0;
636  p_ctx->ltr_to_set.use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic = 0;
637  p_ctx->ltr_to_set.use_long_term_ref = 0;
638  p_ctx->ltr_interval = -1;
639  p_ctx->ltr_frame_ref_invalid = -1;
640  p_ctx->framerate.framerate_num = 0;
641  p_ctx->framerate.framerate_denom = 0;
642  p_ctx->vui.colorDescPresent = 0;
643  p_ctx->vui.colorPrimaries = 0;
644  p_ctx->vui.colorTrc = 0;
645  p_ctx->vui.colorSpace = 0;
646  p_ctx->vui.aspectRatioWidth = 0;
647  p_ctx->vui.aspectRatioHeight = 0;
648  p_ctx->vui.videoFullRange = 0;
649  p_ctx->max_frame_size = 0;
650 
651  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args = NULL;
652 
653  handle = p_ctx->device_handle;
654  handle1 = p_ctx->blk_io_handle;
655 
656  p_device_pool = ni_rsrc_get_device_pool();
657 
658  if (!p_device_pool)
659  {
660  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: Error calling ni_rsrc_get_device_pool()\n");
661  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_GET_DEVICE_POOL;
662  LRETURN;
663  }
664 
665  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: device type %d hw_id %d blk_dev_name: %s.\n",
666  __func__, device_type, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->blk_dev_name);
667 
668  if (device_type == NI_DEVICE_TYPE_UPLOAD)
669  {
670  //uploader shares resources with encoder to query as encoder for load info
671  query_type = NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER;
672  }
673 
674  // if caller requested device by block device name, try to find its GUID and
675  // use it to override the hw_id which is the passed in device GUID
676  if (0 != strcmp(p_ctx->blk_dev_name, ""))
677  {
678  int tmp_guid_id;
679  tmp_guid_id =
680  ni_rsrc_get_device_by_block_name(p_ctx->blk_dev_name, device_type);
681  if (tmp_guid_id != NI_RETCODE_FAILURE)
682  {
683  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
684  "%s: block device name %s type %d guid %d is to "
685  "override passed in guid %d\n",
686  __func__, p_ctx->blk_dev_name, device_type, tmp_guid_id,
687  p_ctx->hw_id);
688  p_ctx->hw_id = tmp_guid_id;
689  } else
690  {
691  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO, "%s: block device name %s type %d NOT found ..\n",
692  __func__, p_ctx->blk_dev_name, device_type);
693  }
694  }
695 
696  // User did not pass in any handle, so we create it for them
697  if ((handle1 == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE) && (handle == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE))
698  {
699  if (p_ctx->hw_id >=0) // User selected the encder/ decoder number
700  {
701  if ((rsrc_ctx = ni_rsrc_allocate_simple_direct(device_type, p_ctx->hw_id)) == NULL)
702  {
703 
704  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Error XCoder resource allocation: inst %d\n",
705  p_ctx->hw_id);
706  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_OPEN_DEVICE;
707  LRETURN;
708  }
709  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "device %p\n", rsrc_ctx);
710  // Now the device name is in the rsrc_ctx, we open this device to get the file handles
711 
712 #ifdef _WIN32
713  if ((handle = ni_device_open(rsrc_ctx->p_device_info->blk_name,
714  &dummy_io_size)) == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE)
715  {
716  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(rsrc_ctx);
717  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_OPEN_DEVICE;
718  LRETURN;
719  } else
720  {
721  user_handles = true;
722  p_ctx->device_handle = handle;
723  p_ctx->blk_io_handle = handle;
724  p_ctx->max_nvme_io_size = dummy_io_size;
725  handle1 = handle;
726  strcpy(p_ctx->dev_xcoder_name, rsrc_ctx->p_device_info->dev_name);
727  strcpy(p_ctx->blk_xcoder_name, rsrc_ctx->p_device_info->blk_name);
728  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(rsrc_ctx);
729  }
730 #else
731  //The original design (code below) is to open char and block device file separately. And the ffmpeg will close the device twice.
732  //However, in I/O version, char device can't be opened. For compatibility, and to avoid errors, open the block device twice.
733  if (((handle = ni_device_open(rsrc_ctx->p_device_info->blk_name, &dummy_io_size)) == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE) ||
734  ((handle1 = ni_device_open(rsrc_ctx->p_device_info->blk_name, &p_ctx->max_nvme_io_size)) == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE))
735  {
736  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(rsrc_ctx);
737  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_OPEN_DEVICE;
738  LRETURN;
739  } else
740  {
741  user_handles = true;
742  p_ctx->device_handle = handle;
743  p_ctx->blk_io_handle = handle1;
744  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-analyzer-core.NonNullParamChecker): Couldn't determine why it will be NULL.
745  strcpy(p_ctx->dev_xcoder_name, rsrc_ctx->p_device_info->dev_name);
746  strcpy(p_ctx->blk_xcoder_name, rsrc_ctx->p_device_info->blk_name);
747 
748  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(rsrc_ctx);
749  }
750 #endif
751  } else
752  {
753  int tmp_id = -1;
754 
755  if (ni_rsrc_lock_and_open(query_type, &lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
756  {
757  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_LOCK_DOWN_DEVICE;
758  LRETURN;
759  }
760 
761  // Then we need to query through all the board to confirm the least model load
762  if (IS_XCODER_DEVICE_TYPE(query_type))
763  {
764  num_coders = p_device_pool->p_device_queue->xcoder_cnt[query_type];
765  } else
766  {
767  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
768  if (ni_rsrc_unlock(query_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
769  {
770  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
771  LRETURN;
772  }
773  LRETURN;
774  }
775 
776  for (i = 0; i < num_coders; i++)
777  {
778  tmp_id = p_device_pool->p_device_queue->xcoders[query_type][i];
779  p_device_context = ni_rsrc_get_device_context(query_type, tmp_id);
780 
781  if (p_device_context == NULL)
782  {
783  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
784  "ERROR: %s() ni_rsrc_get_device_context() failed\n",
785  __func__);
786  continue;
787  }
788 
789  // Code is included in the for loop. In the loop, the device is
790  // just opened once, and it will be closed once too.
791  p_session_context.blk_io_handle = ni_device_open(
792  p_device_context->p_device_info->blk_name, &dummy_io_size);
793  p_session_context.device_handle = p_session_context.blk_io_handle;
794 
795  if (NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE == p_session_context.device_handle)
796  {
797  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Error open device");
798  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(p_device_context);
799  continue;
800  }
801 
802  p_session_context.hw_id = p_device_context->p_device_info->hw_id;
803  rc = ni_device_session_query(&p_session_context, query_type);
804  if (NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE != p_session_context.device_handle)
805  {
806  ni_device_close(p_session_context.device_handle);
807  }
808 
809  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != rc)
810  {
811  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Error query %s %s.%d\n",
812  g_device_type_str[query_type],
813  p_device_context->p_device_info->dev_name,
814  p_device_context->p_device_info->hw_id);
815  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(p_device_context);
816  continue;
817  }
818  ni_rsrc_update_record(p_device_context, &p_session_context);
819  p_dev_info = p_device_context->p_device_info;
820  // here we select the best load
821  // for decoder/encoder: check the model_load
822  // for hwuploader: check directly hwupload count in query result
823  if (NI_DEVICE_TYPE_UPLOAD == device_type)
824  {
825  if (i == 0 || p_session_context.load_query.active_hwuploaders <
826  num_sw_instances)
827  {
828  guid = tmp_id;
829  num_sw_instances =
830  p_session_context.load_query.active_hwuploaders;
831  memcpy(&dev_info, p_dev_info, sizeof(ni_device_info_t));
832  }
833  } else if (i == 0 || p_dev_info->model_load < least_model_load ||
834  (p_dev_info->model_load == least_model_load &&
835  p_dev_info->active_num_inst < num_sw_instances))
836  {
837  guid = tmp_id;
838  least_model_load = p_dev_info->model_load;
839  num_sw_instances = p_dev_info->active_num_inst;
840  memcpy(&dev_info, p_dev_info, sizeof(ni_device_info_t));
841  }
842  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(p_device_context);
843  }
844 
845 #ifdef _WIN32
846  // Now we have the device info that has the least model load of the FW
847  // we open this device and assign the FD
848  if ((handle = ni_device_open(dev_info.blk_name, &dummy_io_size)) ==
849  NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE)
850  {
851  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_OPEN_DEVICE;
852  if (ni_rsrc_unlock(device_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
853  {
854  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
855  LRETURN;
856  }
857  LRETURN;
858  } else
859  {
860  p_ctx->device_handle = handle;
861  p_ctx->blk_io_handle = handle;
862  p_ctx->max_nvme_io_size = dummy_io_size;
863  handle1 = handle;
864  p_ctx->hw_id = guid;
865  strcpy(p_ctx->dev_xcoder_name, dev_info.dev_name);
866  strcpy(p_ctx->blk_xcoder_name, dev_info.blk_name);
867  }
868 #else
869  //The original design (code below) is to open char and block device file separately. And the ffmpeg will close the device twice.
870  //However, in I/O version, char device can't be opened. For compatibility, and to avoid errors, open the block device twice.
871  if (((handle = ni_device_open(dev_info.blk_name, &dummy_io_size)) == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE) ||
872  ((handle1 = ni_device_open(dev_info.blk_name, &p_ctx->max_nvme_io_size)) == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE))
873  {
874  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_OPEN_DEVICE;
875  if (ni_rsrc_unlock(query_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
876  {
877  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
878  LRETURN;
879  }
880  LRETURN;
881  }
882  else
883  {
884  p_ctx->device_handle = handle;
885  p_ctx->blk_io_handle = handle1;
886  p_ctx->hw_id = guid;
887  strcpy(p_ctx->dev_xcoder_name, dev_info.dev_name);
888  strcpy(p_ctx->blk_xcoder_name, dev_info.blk_name);
889  }
890 #endif
891  }
892  }
893  // user passed in the handle, but one of them is invalid, this is error case so we return error
894  else if((handle1 == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE) || (handle == NI_INVALID_DEVICE_HANDLE))
895  {
896  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_HANDLE;
897  LRETURN;
898  }
899  // User passed in both handles, so we do not need to allocate for it
900  else
901  {
902  user_handles = true;
903  }
904 
905  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
906  "Finish open the session dev:%s blk:%s guid:%d handle:%p handle1:%p\n",
907  p_ctx->dev_xcoder_name, p_ctx->blk_xcoder_name, p_ctx->hw_id,
908  p_ctx->device_handle, p_ctx->blk_io_handle);
909 
910  // get FW API version
911  p_device_context = ni_rsrc_get_device_context(device_type, p_ctx->hw_id);
912  if (p_device_context == NULL)
913  {
914  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
915  "ERROR: %s() ni_rsrc_get_device_context() failed\n",
916  __func__);
917  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_OPEN_DEVICE;
918  LRETURN;
919  }
920  memcpy(p_ctx->fw_rev , p_device_context->p_device_info->fw_rev, 8);
921 
922  retval = ni_device_get_ddr_configuration(p_ctx);
923  if (retval != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
924  {
925  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
926  "ERROR: %s() cannot retrieve DDR configuration\n",
927  __func__);
928  LRETURN;
929  }
930 
931  switch (device_type)
932  {
933  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER:
934  {
935  retval = ni_decoder_session_open(p_ctx);
936  if (user_handles != true)
937  {
938  if( ni_rsrc_unlock(device_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
939  {
940  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
941  LRETURN;
942  }
943  }
944  // send keep alive signal thread
945  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
946  {
947  LRETURN;
948  }
949  break;
950  }
951  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER:
952  {
953 #ifndef _WIN32
954  // p2p is not supported on Windows, so skip following assignments.
955  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_enc_params;
956 
957  p_enc_params = p_ctx->p_session_config;
958 
959  if (p_enc_params && p_enc_params->hwframes &&
960  p_enc_params->p_first_frame)
961  {
962  niFrameSurface1_t *pSurface;
963  pSurface =
964  (niFrameSurface1_t *)p_enc_params->p_first_frame->p_data[3];
965  p_ctx->sender_handle =
966  (ni_device_handle_t)(int64_t)pSurface->device_handle;
967  p_enc_params->rootBufId = pSurface->ui16FrameIdx;
968 
969  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: sender_handle and rootBufId %d set\n",
970  __func__, p_enc_params->rootBufId);
971  }
972 #endif
973 
974  retval = ni_encoder_session_open(p_ctx);
975  if (user_handles != true)
976  {
977  if (ni_rsrc_unlock(device_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
978  {
979  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
980  LRETURN;
981  }
982  }
983  // send keep alive signal thread
984  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
985  {
986  LRETURN;
987  }
988  break;
989  }
990  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_UPLOAD:
991  {
992  retval = ni_uploader_session_open(p_ctx);
993  if (user_handles != true)
994  {
995  if (ni_rsrc_unlock(query_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
996  {
997  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
998  LRETURN;
999  }
1000  }
1001  // send keep alive signal thread
1002  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
1003  {
1004  LRETURN;
1005  }
1006  break;
1007  }
1008  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER:
1009  {
1010  retval = ni_scaler_session_open(p_ctx);
1011  if (user_handles != true)
1012  {
1013  if( ni_rsrc_unlock(device_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
1014  {
1015  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
1016  LRETURN;
1017  }
1018  }
1019  // send keep alive signal thread
1020  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
1021  {
1022  LRETURN;
1023  }
1024  break;
1025  }
1026  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI:
1027  {
1028  retval = ni_ai_session_open(p_ctx);
1029  if (user_handles != true)
1030  {
1031  if (ni_rsrc_unlock(device_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
1032  {
1033  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
1034  LRETURN;
1035  }
1036  }
1037  // send keep alive signal thread
1038  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
1039  {
1040  LRETURN;
1041  }
1042  break;
1043  }
1044  default:
1045  {
1046  if (user_handles != true)
1047  {
1048  if( ni_rsrc_unlock(device_type, lock) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
1049  {
1050  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNLOCK_DEVICE;
1051  LRETURN;
1052  }
1053  }
1054  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1055  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unrecognized device type: %d",
1056  __func__, device_type);
1057  LRETURN;
1058  }
1059  }
1060 
1061  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args = (ni_thread_arg_struct_t *) malloc (sizeof(ni_thread_arg_struct_t));
1062  if (!p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args)
1063  {
1064  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: thread_args allocation failed!\n");
1065  ni_device_session_close(p_ctx, 0, device_type);
1066  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
1067  LRETURN;
1068  }
1069 
1070  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->session_id = p_ctx->session_id;
1071  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->session_timestamp = p_ctx->session_timestamp;
1072  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->device_type = device_type;
1073  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->device_handle = p_ctx->blk_io_handle;
1074  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->thread_event_handle = p_ctx->event_handle;
1075  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread = false;
1076  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->keep_alive_timeout = p_ctx->keep_alive_timeout;
1077 
1078  if (ni_posix_memalign(&(p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->p_buffer),
1079  sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN))
1080  {
1081  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: keep alive p_buffer allocation failed!\n");
1082  ni_device_session_close(p_ctx, 0, device_type);
1083  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
1084  LRETURN;
1085  }
1086  memset(p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
1087 
1088  if (0 !=
1089  ni_pthread_create(&p_ctx->keep_alive_thread, NULL,
1090  ni_session_keep_alive_thread,
1091  (void *)p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args))
1092  {
1093  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: failed to create keep alive thread\n");
1094  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread = (ni_pthread_t){0};
1095  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->p_buffer);
1096  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args);
1097  ni_device_session_close(p_ctx, 0, device_type);
1098  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
1099  LRETURN;
1100  }
1101  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Enabled keep alive thread\n");
1102 
1103  // allocate memory for encoder change data to be reused
1104  p_ctx->enc_change_params = calloc(1, sizeof(ni_encoder_change_params_t));
1105  if (!p_ctx->enc_change_params)
1106  {
1107  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: enc_change_params allocation failed!\n");
1108  ni_device_session_close(p_ctx, 0, device_type);
1109  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
1110  }
1111 
1112 END:
1113  ni_device_session_context_clear(&p_session_context);
1114 
1115  ni_rsrc_free_device_context(p_device_context);
1116 
1117  if (p_device_pool)
1118  {
1119  ni_rsrc_free_device_pool(p_device_pool);
1120  p_device_pool = NULL;
1121  }
1122 
1123  p_ctx->xcoder_state &= ~NI_XCODER_OPEN_STATE;
1124 
1125  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1126 
1127  return retval;
1128 }
1129 
1130 /*!*****************************************************************************
1131  * \brief Close device session that was previously opened by calling
1132  * ni_device_session_open()
1133  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER closes decoding session
1134  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER closes encoding session
1135  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER closes scaling session
1136  *
1137  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
1138  * ni_session_context_t struct
1139  * \param[in] eos_received Flag indicating if End Of Stream indicator was
1140  * received
1141  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER,
1142  * or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
1143  * \return On success
1144  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1145  * On failure
1146  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1147  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1148  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
1149  ******************************************************************************/
1150 ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_close(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
1151  int eos_recieved,
1152  ni_device_type_t device_type)
1153 {
1154  int ret;
1155  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1156 
1157  if (!p_ctx)
1158  {
1159  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null, return\n",
1160  __func__);
1161  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1162  }
1163 
1164  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1165  p_ctx->xcoder_state |= NI_XCODER_CLOSE_STATE;
1166  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1167 
1168 #ifdef _WIN32
1169  if (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread.handle && p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args)
1170 #else
1171  if (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread && p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args)
1172 #endif
1173  {
1174  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread = true;
1175  ret = ni_pthread_join(p_ctx->keep_alive_thread, NULL);
1176  if (ret)
1177  {
1178  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
1179  "join keep alive thread fail! : sid %u ret %d\n",
1180  p_ctx->session_id, ret);
1181  }
1182  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->p_buffer);
1183  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args);
1184  } else
1185  {
1186  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "invalid keep alive thread: %u\n",
1187  p_ctx->session_id);
1188  }
1189 
1190  switch (device_type)
1191  {
1192  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER:
1193  {
1194  retval = ni_decoder_session_close(p_ctx, eos_recieved);
1195  break;
1196  }
1197  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_UPLOAD:
1198  {
1199  ni_uploader_session_close(p_ctx);
1200  // fall through
1201  }
1202  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER:
1203  {
1204  retval = ni_encoder_session_close(p_ctx, eos_recieved);
1205  break;
1206  }
1207  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER:
1208  {
1209  retval = ni_scaler_session_close(p_ctx, eos_recieved);
1210  break;
1211  }
1212  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI:
1213  {
1214  retval = ni_ai_session_close(p_ctx, eos_recieved);
1215  break;
1216  }
1217  default:
1218  {
1219  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1220  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unrecognized device type: %d",
1221  __func__, device_type);
1222  break;
1223  }
1224  }
1225 
1226  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1227  // need set invalid after closed. May cause open invalid parameters.
1228  p_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
1229 
1230  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->p_hdr_buf);
1231  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->av_rois);
1232  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->roi_map);
1233  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->p_master_display_meta_data);
1234  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->enc_change_params);
1235  p_ctx->hdr_buf_size = 0;
1236  p_ctx->roi_side_data_size = 0;
1237  p_ctx->nb_rois = 0;
1238  p_ctx->target_bitrate = -1;
1239  p_ctx->force_idr_frame = 0;
1240  p_ctx->ltr_to_set.use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic = 0;
1241  p_ctx->ltr_to_set.use_long_term_ref = 0;
1242  p_ctx->ltr_interval = -1;
1243  p_ctx->ltr_frame_ref_invalid = -1;
1244 
1245  p_ctx->xcoder_state &= ~NI_XCODER_CLOSE_STATE;
1246  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1247 
1248  return retval;
1249 }
1250 
1251 /*!*****************************************************************************
1252  * \brief Send a flush command to the device
1253  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER sends flush command to
1254  * decoder
1255  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER sends flush command to
1256  * encoder
1257  *
1258  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
1259  * ni_session_context_t struct
1260  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER
1261  * \return On success
1262  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1263  * On failure
1264  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1265  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1266  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
1267  ******************************************************************************/
1268 ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_flush(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_device_type_t device_type)
1269 {
1270  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1271  if (!p_ctx)
1272  {
1273  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null, return\n",
1274  __func__);
1275  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1276  }
1277 
1278  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1279  p_ctx->xcoder_state |= NI_XCODER_FLUSH_STATE;
1280 
1281  switch (device_type)
1282  {
1283  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER:
1284  {
1285  retval = ni_decoder_session_flush(p_ctx);
1286  break;
1287  }
1288  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER:
1289  {
1290  retval = ni_encoder_session_flush(p_ctx);
1291  break;
1292  }
1293  default:
1294  {
1295  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1296  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unrecognized device type: %d",
1297  __func__, device_type);
1298  break;
1299  }
1300  }
1301  p_ctx->ready_to_close = (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS == retval);
1302  p_ctx->xcoder_state &= ~NI_XCODER_FLUSH_STATE;
1303  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1304  return retval;
1305 }
1306 
1307 /*!*****************************************************************************
1308  * \brief Save a stream's headers in a decoder session that can be used later
1309  * for continuous decoding from the same source.
1310  *
1311  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
1312  * ni_session_context_t struct
1313  * \param[in] hdr_data Pointer to header data
1314  * \param[in] hdr_size Size of header data in bytes
1315  * \return On success
1316  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1317  * On failure
1318  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1319  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1320  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
1321  ******************************************************************************/
1322 ni_retcode_t ni_device_dec_session_save_hdrs(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
1323  uint8_t *hdr_data,
1324  uint8_t hdr_size)
1325 {
1326  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1327 
1328  if (!p_ctx)
1329  {
1330  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s p_ctx null, return\n", __func__);
1331  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1332  }
1333 
1334  if (!hdr_data)
1335  {
1336  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s hdr_data null, return\n", __func__);
1337  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1338  } else if (p_ctx->p_hdr_buf && p_ctx->hdr_buf_size == hdr_size &&
1339  0 == memcmp(p_ctx->p_hdr_buf, hdr_data, hdr_size))
1340  {
1341  // no change from the saved headers, success !
1342  return retval;
1343  }
1344 
1345  // update the saved header data
1346  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->p_hdr_buf);
1347  p_ctx->hdr_buf_size = 0;
1348  p_ctx->p_hdr_buf = malloc(hdr_size);
1349  if (p_ctx->p_hdr_buf)
1350  {
1351  memcpy(p_ctx->p_hdr_buf, hdr_data, hdr_size);
1352  p_ctx->hdr_buf_size = hdr_size;
1353  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s saved hdr size %u\n", __func__,
1354  p_ctx->hdr_buf_size);
1355  } else
1356  {
1357  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
1358  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s no memory.\n", __func__);
1359  }
1360  return retval;
1361 }
1362 
1363 /*!*****************************************************************************
1364  * \brief Flush a decoder session to get ready to continue decoding.
1365  * Note: this is different from ni_device_session_flush in that it closes the
1366  * current decode session and opens a new one for continuous decoding.
1367  *
1368  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
1369  * ni_session_context_t struct
1370  * \return On success
1371  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1372  * On failure
1373  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1374  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1375  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
1376  ******************************************************************************/
1377 ni_retcode_t ni_device_dec_session_flush(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx)
1378 {
1379  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1380  uint8_t *p_tmp_data = NULL;
1381  uint8_t tmp_data_size = 0;
1382 
1383  if (!p_ctx)
1384  {
1385  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s ctx null, return\n", __func__);
1386  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1387  }
1388 
1389  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1390  p_ctx->xcoder_state |= NI_XCODER_INTER_FLUSH_STATE;
1391  // save the stream header data for the new session to be opened
1392  if (p_ctx->p_hdr_buf && p_ctx->hdr_buf_size)
1393  {
1394  p_tmp_data = malloc(p_ctx->hdr_buf_size);
1395  if (p_tmp_data)
1396  {
1397  memcpy(p_tmp_data, p_ctx->p_hdr_buf, p_ctx->hdr_buf_size);
1398  tmp_data_size = p_ctx->hdr_buf_size;
1399  } else
1400  {
1401  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
1402  }
1403  }
1404 
1405  // close the current session and open a new one
1406  ni_device_session_close(p_ctx, 0, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER);
1407 
1408  if ((retval = ni_device_session_open(p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER)) ==
1409  NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
1410  {
1411  // copy over the saved stream header to be sent as part of the first
1412  // data to decoder
1413  if (p_tmp_data && tmp_data_size && p_ctx->p_leftover)
1414  {
1415  ni_device_dec_session_save_hdrs(p_ctx, p_tmp_data, tmp_data_size);
1416  memcpy(p_ctx->p_leftover, p_ctx->p_hdr_buf, p_ctx->hdr_buf_size);
1417  p_ctx->prev_size = p_ctx->hdr_buf_size;
1418  }
1419  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s completed, hdr size %u saved.\n", __func__,
1420  p_ctx->hdr_buf_size);
1421  }
1422 
1423  ni_aligned_free(p_tmp_data);
1424  p_ctx->xcoder_state &= ~NI_XCODER_INTER_FLUSH_STATE;
1425  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1426  return retval;
1427 }
1428 
1429 /*!*****************************************************************************
1430  * \brief Sends data to the device
1431  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER sends data packet to
1432  * decoder
1433  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER sends data frame to encoder
1434  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI sends data frame to ai engine
1435  *
1436  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
1437  * ni_session_context_t struct
1438  * \param[in] p_data Pointer to a caller allocated
1439  * ni_session_data_io_t struct which contains either a
1440  * ni_frame_t data frame or ni_packet_t data packet to
1441  * send
1442  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER or
1443  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI
1444  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER is specified, it is
1445  * expected that the ni_packet_t struct inside the
1446  * p_data pointer contains data to send.
1447  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER or NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI is
1448  * specified, it is expected that the ni_frame_t
1449  * struct inside the p_data pointer contains data to
1450  * send.
1451  * \return On success
1452  * Total number of bytes written
1453  * On failure
1454  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1455  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1456  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
1457  ******************************************************************************/
1458 int ni_device_session_write(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx, ni_session_data_io_t *p_data, ni_device_type_t device_type)
1459 {
1460  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1461 
1462  if (!p_ctx || !p_data)
1463  {
1464  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null, return\n",
1465  __func__);
1466  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1467  }
1468  // Here check if keep alive thread is closed.
1469 #ifdef _WIN32
1470  if (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread.handle &&
1471  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread)
1472 #else
1473  if (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread && p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread)
1474 #endif
1475  {
1476  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
1477  "ERROR: %s() keep alive thread has been closed, "
1478  "hw:%d, session:%d\n",
1479  __func__, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id);
1480  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
1481  }
1482 
1483  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1484  // In close state, let the close process execute first.
1485  if (p_ctx->xcoder_state & NI_XCODER_CLOSE_STATE ||
1486  #ifdef _WIN32
1487  (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread.handle &&
1488  #else
1489  (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread &&
1490  #endif
1491  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread))
1492  {
1493  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s close state, return\n", __func__);
1494  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1495  ni_usleep(100);
1496  return NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1497  }
1498  p_ctx->xcoder_state |= NI_XCODER_WRITE_STATE;
1499  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1500 
1501  switch (device_type)
1502  {
1503  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER:
1504  {
1505  retval = ni_decoder_session_write(p_ctx, &(p_data->data.packet));
1506  break;
1507  }
1508  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER:
1509  {
1510  retval = ni_encoder_session_write(p_ctx, &(p_data->data.frame));
1511  break;
1512  }
1513  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI:
1514  {
1515  retval = ni_ai_session_write(p_ctx, &(p_data->data.frame));
1516  break;
1517  }
1518  default:
1519  {
1520  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1521  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unrecognized device type: %d",
1522  __func__, device_type);
1523  break;
1524  }
1525  }
1526 
1527  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1528  p_ctx->xcoder_state &= ~NI_XCODER_WRITE_STATE;
1529  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1530  return retval;
1531 }
1532 
1533 /*!*****************************************************************************
1534  * \brief Read data from the device
1535  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER reads data packet from
1536  * decoder
1537  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER reads data frame from
1538  * encoder
1539  * If device_type is NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI reads data frame from AI engine
1540  *
1541  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
1542  * ni_session_context_t struct
1543  * \param[in] p_data Pointer to a caller allocated ni_session_data_io_t
1544  * struct which contains either a ni_frame_t data frame
1545  * or ni_packet_t data packet to send
1546  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, or
1547  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER
1548  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER is specified, data that
1549  * was read will be placed into ni_frame_t struct
1550  * inside the p_data pointer
1551  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER is specified, data that
1552  * was read will be placed into ni_packet_t struct
1553  * inside the p_data pointer
1554  * If NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI is specified, data that was
1555  * read will be placed into ni_frame_t struct inside
1556  * the p_data pointer
1557  * \return On success
1558  * Total number of bytes read
1559  * On failure
1560  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1561  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1562  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
1563  ******************************************************************************/
1564 int ni_device_session_read(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx, ni_session_data_io_t *p_data, ni_device_type_t device_type)
1565 {
1566  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1567  if ((!p_ctx) || (!p_data))
1568  {
1569  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null, return\n",
1570  __func__);
1571  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1572  }
1573 
1574  // Here check if keep alive thread is closed.
1575 #ifdef _WIN32
1576  if (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread.handle &&
1577  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread)
1578 #else
1579  if (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread && p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread)
1580 #endif
1581  {
1582  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
1583  "ERROR: %s() keep alive thread has been closed, "
1584  "hw:%d, session:%d\n",
1585  __func__, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id);
1586  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
1587  }
1588 
1589  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1590  // In close state, let the close process execute first.
1591  if (p_ctx->xcoder_state & NI_XCODER_CLOSE_STATE ||
1592  #ifdef _WIN32
1593  (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread.handle &&
1594  #else
1595  (p_ctx->keep_alive_thread &&
1596  #endif
1597  p_ctx->keep_alive_thread_args->close_thread))
1598  {
1599  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s close state, return\n", __func__);
1600  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1601  ni_usleep(100);
1602  return NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1603  }
1604  p_ctx->xcoder_state |= NI_XCODER_READ_STATE;
1605  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1606 
1607  switch (device_type)
1608  {
1609  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER:
1610  {
1611  int seq_change_read_count = 0;
1612  for (;;)
1613  {
1614  retval = ni_decoder_session_read(p_ctx, &(p_data->data.frame));
1615  // check resolution change only after initial setting obtained
1616  // p_data->data.frame.video_width is picture width and will be 32-align
1617  // adjusted to frame size; p_data->data.frame.video_height is the same as
1618  // frame size, then compare them to saved one for resolution checking
1619  //
1620  uint32_t aligned_width;
1621  if(QUADRA)
1622  {
1623  aligned_width = ((((p_data->data.frame.video_width * p_ctx->bit_depth_factor) + 127) / 128) * 128);
1624  }
1625  else
1626  {
1627  aligned_width = ((p_data->data.frame.video_width + 31) / 32) * 32;
1628  }
1629 
1630  if (0 == retval && seq_change_read_count)
1631  {
1632  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
1633  "%s (decoder): seq change NO data, next time.\n", __func__);
1634  p_ctx->active_video_width = 0;
1635  p_ctx->active_video_height = 0;
1636  p_ctx->actual_video_width = 0;
1637  break;
1638  }
1639  else if (retval < 0)
1640  {
1641  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "%s (decoder): failure ret %d, return ..\n",
1642  __func__, retval);
1643  break;
1644  }
1645  else if (p_ctx->frame_num && p_data->data.frame.video_width &&
1646  p_data->data.frame.video_height &&
1647  (aligned_width != p_ctx->active_video_width ||
1648  p_data->data.frame.video_height != p_ctx->active_video_height))
1649  {
1650  ni_log(
1651  NI_LOG_DEBUG,
1652  "%s (decoder): resolution change, frame size %ux%u -> %ux%u, "
1653  "width %u bit %d, continue read ...\n",
1654  __func__, p_ctx->active_video_width, p_ctx->active_video_height,
1655  aligned_width, p_data->data.frame.video_height,
1656  p_data->data.frame.video_width, p_ctx->bit_depth_factor);
1657  // reset active video resolution to 0 so it can be queried in the re-read
1658  p_ctx->active_video_width = 0;
1659  p_ctx->active_video_height = 0;
1660  p_ctx->actual_video_width = 0;
1661  seq_change_read_count++;
1662  }
1663  else
1664  {
1665  break;
1666  }
1667  }
1668  break;
1669  }
1670  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER:
1671  {
1672  retval = ni_encoder_session_read(p_ctx, &(p_data->data.packet));
1673  break;
1674  }
1675  case NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI:
1676  {
1677  retval = ni_ai_session_read(p_ctx, &(p_data->data.packet));
1678  break;
1679  }
1680  default:
1681  {
1682  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1683  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unrecognized device type: %d",
1684  __func__, device_type);
1685  break;
1686  }
1687  }
1688 
1689  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1690  p_ctx->xcoder_state &= ~NI_XCODER_READ_STATE;
1691  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
1692  return retval;
1693 }
1694 
1695 /*!*****************************************************************************
1696  * \brief Query session data from the device -
1697  * If device_type is valid, will query session data
1698  * from specified device type
1699  *
1700  * \param[in] p_ctx Pointer to a caller allocated
1701  * ni_session_context_t struct
1702  * \param[in] device_type NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER or
1703  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER or
1704  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER or
1705  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_AI or
1706  * NI_DEVICE_TYPE_UPLOADER
1707  *
1708  * \return On success
1709  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1710  * On failure
1711  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1712  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1713  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
1714  ******************************************************************************/
1715 ni_retcode_t ni_device_session_query(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_device_type_t device_type)
1716 {
1717  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1718  if (!p_ctx)
1719  {
1720  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null, return\n",
1721  __func__);
1722  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1723  }
1724 
1725  if (IS_XCODER_DEVICE_TYPE(device_type))
1726  {
1727  retval = ni_xcoder_session_query(p_ctx, device_type);
1728  } else
1729  {
1730  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1731  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unrecognized device type: %d",
1732  __func__, device_type);
1733  }
1734 
1735  return retval;
1736 }
1737 
1738 /*!*****************************************************************************
1739  * \brief Send namespace num and SRIOv index to the device with specified logic block
1740  * address.
1741  *
1742  * \param[in] device_handle Device handle obtained by calling ni_device_open
1743  * \param[in] namespace_num Set the namespace number with designated sriov
1744  * \param[in] sriov_index Identify which sriov need to be set
1745  *
1746  * \return On success
1747  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1748  * On failure
1749  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
1750  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
1751  ******************************************************************************/
1752 ni_retcode_t ni_device_config_namespace_num(ni_device_handle_t device_handle,
1753  uint32_t namespace_num, uint32_t sriov_index)
1754 {
1755  char buf[NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN] = {'\0'};
1756  buf[0] = (uint8_t)namespace_num;
1757  buf[1] = (uint8_t)sriov_index;
1758  // event handle could be ignored
1759  return ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(device_handle, NI_INVALID_EVENT_HANDLE,
1760  (void *)buf, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, CONFIG_GLOBAL_NAMESPACE_NUM);
1761 }
1762 
1763 /*!*****************************************************************************
1764  * \brief Allocate preliminary memory for the frame buffer based on provided
1765  * parameters. Applicable to YUV420 Planar pixel (8 or 10 bit/pixel)
1766  * format or 32-bit RGBA.
1767  *
1768  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated
1769  * ni_frame_t struct
1770  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
1771  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
1772  * \param[in] alignment Allignment requirement
1773  * \param[in] metadata_flag Flag indicating if space for additional metadata
1774  * should be allocated
1775  * \param[in] factor 1 for 8 bits/pixel format, 2 for 10 bits/pixel,
1776  * 4 for 32 bits/pixel (RGBA)
1777  * \param[in] hw_frame_count Number of hw descriptors stored
1778  * \param[in] is_planar 0 if semiplanar else planar
1779  *
1780  * \return On success
1781  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1782  * On failure
1783  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1784  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
1785  ******************************************************************************/
1786 ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_alloc(ni_frame_t *p_frame, int video_width,
1787  int video_height, int alignment,
1788  int metadata_flag, int factor,
1789  int hw_frame_count, int is_planar)
1790 {
1791  void* p_buffer = NULL;
1792  int metadata_size = 0;
1793  int retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1794  // TBD for sequence change (non-regular resolution video sample):
1795  // width has to be 16-aligned to prevent f/w assertion
1796  int width_aligned = video_width;
1797  int height_aligned = video_height;
1798 
1799  if ((!p_frame) || ((factor!=1) && (factor!=2) && (factor !=4))
1800  || (video_width>NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_WIDTH) || (video_width<=0)
1801  || (video_height>NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT) || (video_height<=0))
1802  {
1803  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null or not supported, "
1804  "factor %d, video_width %d, video_height %d\n",
1805  __func__, factor, video_width, video_height);
1806  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1807  }
1808 
1809  if (metadata_flag)
1810  {
1811  metadata_size = NI_FW_META_DATA_SZ + NI_MAX_SEI_DATA;
1812  }
1813 
1814  if (QUADRA)
1815  {
1816  switch (factor)
1817  {
1818  case 1: /* 8-bit YUV420 */
1819  case 2: /* 10-bit YUV420 */
1820  width_aligned = ((((video_width * factor) + 127) / 128) * 128) / factor;
1821  height_aligned = ((video_height + 1) / 2) * 2;
1822  break;
1823  case 4: /* 32-bit RGBA */
1824  /* 2D engine has no height/width alignment requirements for RGBA */
1825  width_aligned = video_width;
1826  height_aligned = video_height;
1827  break;
1828  default:
1829  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1830  }
1831  }
1832  else
1833  {
1834  width_aligned = ((video_width + 31) / 32) * 32;
1835  height_aligned = ((video_height + 7) / 8) * 8;
1836  if (alignment)
1837  {
1838  height_aligned = ((video_height + 15) / 16) * 16;
1839  }
1840  }
1841 
1842  int luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned * factor;
1843  int chroma_b_size;
1844  int chroma_r_size;
1845  if (QUADRA)
1846  {
1847  int chroma_width_aligned = ((((video_width / 2 * factor) + 127) / 128) * 128) / factor;
1848  if (is_planar == NI_PIXEL_PLANAR_FORMAT_TILED4X4 ||
1849  is_planar == NI_PIXEL_PLANAR_FORMAT_SEMIPLANAR)
1850  {
1851  chroma_width_aligned =
1852  ((((video_width * factor) + 127) / 128) * 128) / factor;
1853  }
1854  int chroma_height_aligned = height_aligned / 2;
1855  chroma_b_size = chroma_r_size = chroma_width_aligned * chroma_height_aligned * factor;
1856  if (is_planar == NI_PIXEL_PLANAR_FORMAT_TILED4X4 ||
1857  is_planar == NI_PIXEL_PLANAR_FORMAT_SEMIPLANAR)
1858  {
1859  chroma_r_size = 0;
1860  }
1861  //ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: factor %d chroma_aligned=%dx%d org=%dx%d\n", __func__, factor, chroma_width_aligned, chroma_height_aligned, video_width, video_height);
1862  }
1863  else
1864  {
1865  chroma_b_size = luma_size / 4;
1866  chroma_r_size = chroma_b_size;
1867  }
1868  int buffer_size;
1869 
1870  /* if hw_frame_count is zero, this is a software frame */
1871  if (hw_frame_count == 0)
1872  buffer_size = luma_size + chroma_b_size + chroma_r_size + metadata_size;
1873  else
1874  buffer_size =
1875  (int)sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t) * hw_frame_count + metadata_size;
1876 
1877  // added 2 blocks of 512 bytes buffer space to handle any extra metadata
1878  // retrieval from fw
1879  buffer_size = ((buffer_size + (NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1)) / NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) * NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT + NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT * 3;
1880  //ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: luma_size %d chroma_b_size %d chroma_r_size %d metadata_size %d buffer_size %d\n", __func__, luma_size, chroma_b_size, chroma_r_size, metadata_size, buffer_size);
1881 
1882  //Check if need to free
1883  if ((p_frame->buffer_size != buffer_size) && (p_frame->buffer_size > 0))
1884  {
1885  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
1886  "%s: free current p_frame, p_frame->buffer_size=%u\n", __func__,
1887  p_frame->buffer_size);
1888  ni_frame_buffer_free(p_frame);
1889  }
1890 
1891  //Check if need to realocate
1892  if (p_frame->buffer_size != buffer_size)
1893  {
1894  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), buffer_size))
1895  {
1896  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate p_frame buffer.\n",
1897  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
1898  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
1899  LRETURN;
1900  }
1901 
1902  // init once after allocation
1903  //memset(p_buffer, 0, buffer_size);
1904  p_frame->buffer_size = buffer_size;
1905  p_frame->p_buffer = p_buffer;
1906 
1907  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: Allocate new p_frame buffer\n", __func__);
1908  }
1909  else
1910  {
1911  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: reuse p_frame buffer\n", __func__);
1912  }
1913 
1914  if (hw_frame_count)
1915  {
1916  p_frame->data_len[0] = 0;
1917  p_frame->data_len[1] = 0;
1918  p_frame->data_len[2] = 0;
1919  p_frame->data_len[3] = sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t)*hw_frame_count;
1920  }
1921  else
1922  {
1923  p_frame->data_len[0] = luma_size;
1924  p_frame->data_len[1] = chroma_b_size;
1925  p_frame->data_len[2] = chroma_r_size;
1926  p_frame->data_len[3] = 0;//unused by hwdesc
1927  }
1928 
1929  p_frame->p_data[0] = p_frame->p_buffer;
1930  p_frame->p_data[1] = p_frame->p_data[0] + p_frame->data_len[0];
1931  p_frame->p_data[2] = p_frame->p_data[1] + p_frame->data_len[1];
1932  p_frame->p_data[3] = p_frame->p_data[2] + p_frame->data_len[2]; //hwdescriptor
1933 
1934  // init p_data[3] to 0 so that ni_frame_buffer_free frees only valid DMA buf
1935  // fd in hw frame read from fw
1936  if (hw_frame_count)
1937  {
1938  memset(p_frame->p_data[3], 0, sizeof(niFrameSurface1_t) * hw_frame_count);
1939  }
1940 
1941  p_frame->video_width = width_aligned;
1942  p_frame->video_height = height_aligned;
1943 
1944  //ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "ni_frame_buffer_alloc: p_buffer %p p_data [%p %p %p %p] data_len [%d %d %d %d] video_width %d video_height %d\n", p_frame->p_buffer, p_frame->p_data[0], p_frame->p_data[1], p_frame->p_data[2], p_frame->p_data[3], p_frame->data_len[0], p_frame->data_len[1], p_frame->data_len[2], p_frame->data_len[3], p_frame->video_width, p_frame->video_height);
1945  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: success: p_frame->buffer_size=%u\n", __func__,
1946  p_frame->buffer_size);
1947 
1948 END:
1949 
1950  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
1951  {
1952  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
1953  }
1954 
1955  return retval;
1956 }
1957 
1958 /*!*****************************************************************************
1959  * \brief Allocate preliminary memory for the frame buffer based on provided
1960  * parameters.
1961  *
1962  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated
1963  * ni_frame_t struct
1964  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
1965  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
1966  * \param[in] alignment Allignment requirement
1967  * \param[in] pixel_format Format for input
1968  *
1969  * \return On success
1970  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
1971  * On failure
1972  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
1973  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
1974  ******************************************************************************/
1975 ni_retcode_t ni_frame_buffer_alloc_dl(ni_frame_t *p_frame, int video_width,
1976  int video_height, int pixel_format)
1977 {
1978  void *p_buffer = NULL;
1979  int retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
1980  int width_aligned = video_width;
1981  int height_aligned = video_height;
1982  int buffer_size;
1983  int luma_size;
1984  int chroma_b_size;
1985  int chroma_r_size;
1986 
1987  if ((!p_frame) || (video_width > NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_WIDTH) ||
1988  (video_width <= 0) || (video_height > NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT) ||
1989  (video_height <= 0))
1990  {
1991  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
1992  "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null or not supported, "
1993  "video_width %d, video_height %d\n",
1994  __func__, video_width, video_height);
1995  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
1996  }
1997 
1998  switch (pixel_format)
1999  {
2000  case NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P:
2001  width_aligned = NI_VPU_ALIGN128(video_width);
2002  height_aligned = NI_VPU_CEIL(video_height, 2);
2003 
2004  luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned;
2005  chroma_b_size =
2006  NI_VPU_ALIGN128(video_width / 2) * height_aligned / 2;
2007  chroma_r_size = chroma_b_size;
2008  break;
2009  case NI_PIX_FMT_YUV420P10LE:
2010  width_aligned = NI_VPU_ALIGN128(video_width * 2) / 2;
2011  height_aligned = NI_VPU_CEIL(video_height, 2);
2012 
2013  luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned * 2;
2014  chroma_b_size = NI_VPU_ALIGN128(video_width) * height_aligned / 2;
2015  chroma_r_size = chroma_b_size;
2016  break;
2017  case NI_PIX_FMT_NV12:
2018  width_aligned = NI_VPU_ALIGN128(video_width);
2019  height_aligned = NI_VPU_CEIL(video_height, 2);
2020 
2021  luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned;
2022  chroma_b_size = width_aligned * height_aligned / 2;
2023  chroma_r_size = 0;
2024  break;
2025  case NI_PIX_FMT_P010LE:
2026  width_aligned = NI_VPU_ALIGN128(video_width * 2) / 2;
2027  height_aligned = NI_VPU_CEIL(video_height, 2);
2028 
2029  luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned * 2;
2030  chroma_b_size = NI_VPU_ALIGN128(video_width) * height_aligned;
2031  chroma_r_size = 0;
2032  break;
2033  case NI_PIX_FMT_NV16:
2034  width_aligned = video_width;
2035  height_aligned = video_height;
2036 
2037  luma_size = video_width * video_height;
2038  chroma_b_size = luma_size;
2039  chroma_r_size = 0;
2040  break;
2041  case NI_PIX_FMT_YUYV422:
2042  case NI_PIX_FMT_UYVY422:
2043  width_aligned = NI_VPU_ALIGN16(video_width);
2044  height_aligned = video_height;
2045 
2046  luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned * 2;
2047  chroma_b_size = 0;
2048  chroma_r_size = 0;
2049  break;
2050  case NI_PIX_FMT_RGBA:
2051  case NI_PIX_FMT_BGRA:
2052  case NI_PIX_FMT_ARGB:
2053  case NI_PIX_FMT_ABGR:
2054  case NI_PIX_FMT_BGR0:
2055  width_aligned = NI_VPU_ALIGN16(video_width);
2056  height_aligned = video_height;
2057 
2058  luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned * 4;
2059  chroma_b_size = 0;
2060  chroma_r_size = 0;
2061  break;
2062  case NI_PIX_FMT_BGRP:
2063  width_aligned = video_width;
2064  height_aligned = video_height;
2065 
2066  luma_size = NI_VPU_ALIGN32(width_aligned * height_aligned);
2067  chroma_b_size = luma_size;
2068  chroma_r_size = luma_size;
2069  break;
2070  default:
2071  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Unknown pixel format %d\n", pixel_format);
2072  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
2073  }
2074 
2075  /* Allocate local memory to hold a software ni_frame */
2076  buffer_size = luma_size + chroma_b_size + chroma_r_size;
2077 
2078  /* Round up to nearest 4K block */
2079  buffer_size = NI_VPU_ALIGN4096(buffer_size);
2080 
2081  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: Rlen %d Glen %d Blen %d buffer_size %d\n",
2082  __func__, luma_size, chroma_b_size, chroma_r_size, buffer_size);
2083 
2084  /* If the frame has changed, reallocate it */
2085  if ((p_frame->buffer_size != buffer_size) && (p_frame->buffer_size > 0))
2086  {
2087  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
2088  "%s: free current p_frame, p_frame->buffer_size=%u\n", __func__,
2089  p_frame->buffer_size);
2090  ni_frame_buffer_free(p_frame);
2091  }
2092 
2093  /* Check if need to reallocate */
2094  if (p_frame->buffer_size != buffer_size)
2095  {
2096  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: Allocate new p_frame buffer\n", __func__);
2097  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), buffer_size))
2098  {
2099  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
2100  "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate p_frame buffer.\n", NI_ERRNO,
2101  __func__);
2102  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2103  LRETURN;
2104  }
2105  } else
2106  {
2107  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: reuse p_frame buffer\n", __func__);
2108  }
2109 
2110  // init once after allocation
2111  // memset(p_buffer, 0, buffer_size);
2112 
2113  p_frame->buffer_size = buffer_size;
2114  p_frame->p_buffer = p_buffer;
2115 
2116  p_frame->data_len[0] = luma_size;
2117  p_frame->data_len[1] = chroma_b_size;
2118  p_frame->data_len[2] = chroma_r_size;
2119  p_frame->data_len[3] = 0;
2120 
2121  p_frame->p_data[0] = (uint8_t *)p_frame->p_buffer;
2122  p_frame->p_data[1] = (uint8_t *)p_frame->p_data[0] + p_frame->data_len[0];
2123  p_frame->p_data[2] = (uint8_t *)p_frame->p_data[1] + p_frame->data_len[1];
2124  p_frame->p_data[3] = (uint8_t *)p_frame->p_data[2] + p_frame->data_len[2];
2125 
2126  // init p_data[3] to 0 so that ni_frame_buffer_free frees only valid DMA buf
2127  // fd in hw frame read from fw
2128  p_frame->video_width = width_aligned;
2129  p_frame->video_height = height_aligned;
2130 
2131  // ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "ni_frame_buffer_alloc: p_buffer %p p_data [%p %p %p %p] data_len [%d %d %d %d] video_width %d video_height %d\n", p_frame->p_buffer, p_frame->p_data[0], p_frame->p_data[1], p_frame->p_data[2], p_frame->p_data[3], p_frame->data_len[0], p_frame->data_len[1], p_frame->data_len[2], p_frame->data_len[3], p_frame->video_width, p_frame->video_height);
2132  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: success: p_frame->buffer_size=%u\n", __func__,
2133  p_frame->buffer_size);
2134 END:
2135 
2136  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
2137  {
2138  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
2139  }
2140 
2141  return retval;
2142 }
2143 
2144 /*!*****************************************************************************
2145  * \brief Allocate memory for decoder frame buffer based on provided
2146  * parameters; the memory is retrieved from a buffer pool and will be
2147  * returned to the same buffer pool by ni_decoder_frame_buffer_free.
2148  * Note: all attributes of ni_frame_t will be set up except for memory and
2149  * buffer, which rely on the pool being allocated; the pool will be
2150  * allocated only after the frame resolution is known.
2151  *
2152  * \param[in] p_pool Buffer pool to get the memory from
2153  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated ni_frame_t struct
2154  * \param[in] alloc_mem Whether to get memory from buffer pool
2155  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
2156  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
2157  * \param[in] alignment Alignment requirement
2158  * \param[in] factor 1 for 8 bits/pixel format, 2 for 10 bits/pixel
2159  * \param[in] is_planar 0 if semiplanar else planar
2160  *
2161  * \return On success
2162  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2163  * On failure
2164  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2165  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2166  ******************************************************************************/
2167 ni_retcode_t ni_decoder_frame_buffer_alloc(ni_buf_pool_t *p_pool,
2168  ni_frame_t *p_frame, int alloc_mem,
2169  int video_width, int video_height,
2170  int alignment, int factor,
2171  int is_planar)
2172 {
2173  void* p_buffer = NULL;
2174  int retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
2175 
2176  int width_aligned;
2177  int height_aligned;
2178 
2179  if ((!p_frame) || ((factor!=1) && (factor!=2))
2180  || (video_width > NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_WIDTH) || (video_width <= 0)
2181  || (video_height > NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT) || (video_height <= 0))
2182  {
2183  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null or not supported, "
2184  "factor %d, video_width %d, video_height %d\n",
2185  __func__, factor, video_width, video_height);
2186  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
2187  }
2188 
2189  if (QUADRA)
2190  {
2191  width_aligned = ((((video_width * factor) + 127) / 128) * 128) / factor;
2192  height_aligned = video_height;
2193  }
2194  else
2195  {
2196  width_aligned = ((video_width + 31) / 32) * 32;
2197  height_aligned = ((video_height + 7) / 8) * 8;
2198  if (alignment)
2199  {
2200  height_aligned = ((video_height + 15) / 16) * 16;
2201  }
2202  }
2203 
2204  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: aligned=%dx%d orig=%dx%d\n", __func__,
2205  width_aligned, height_aligned, video_width, video_height);
2206 
2207  int luma_size = width_aligned * height_aligned * factor;
2208  int chroma_b_size;
2209  int chroma_r_size;
2210  if (QUADRA)
2211  {
2212  int chroma_width_aligned = ((((video_width / 2 * factor) + 127) / 128) * 128) / factor;
2213  if (!is_planar)
2214  {
2215  chroma_width_aligned =
2216  ((((video_width * factor) + 127) / 128) * 128) / factor;
2217  }
2218  int chroma_height_aligned = height_aligned / 2;
2219  chroma_b_size = chroma_r_size = chroma_width_aligned * chroma_height_aligned * factor;
2220  if (!is_planar)
2221  {
2222  chroma_r_size = 0;
2223  }
2224  }
2225  else
2226  {
2227  chroma_b_size = luma_size / 4;
2228  chroma_r_size = chroma_b_size;
2229  }
2230  int buffer_size = luma_size + chroma_b_size + chroma_r_size +
2231  NI_FW_META_DATA_SZ + NI_MAX_SEI_DATA;
2232 
2233  // added 2 blocks of 512 bytes buffer space to handle any extra metadata
2234  // retrieval from fw
2235  buffer_size = ((buffer_size + (NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1)) / NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) * NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT + NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT * 3;
2236 
2237  p_frame->buffer_size = buffer_size;
2238 
2239  // if need to get a buffer from pool, pool must have been set up
2240  if (alloc_mem)
2241  {
2242  if (! p_pool)
2243  {
2244  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s: invalid pool!\n", __func__);
2245  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2246  LRETURN;
2247  }
2248 
2249  p_frame->dec_buf = ni_buf_pool_get_buffer(p_pool);
2250  if (! p_frame->dec_buf)
2251  {
2252  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2253  LRETURN;
2254  }
2255 
2256  p_frame->p_buffer = p_frame->dec_buf->buf;
2257 
2258  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: got new frame ptr %p buffer %p\n", __func__,
2259  p_frame->p_buffer, p_frame->dec_buf);
2260  }
2261  else
2262  {
2263  p_frame->dec_buf = NULL;
2264  p_frame->p_buffer = NULL;
2265  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: NOT alloc mem buffer\n", __func__);
2266  }
2267 
2268  if (p_frame->p_buffer)
2269  {
2270  p_frame->p_data[0] = p_frame->p_buffer;
2271  p_frame->p_data[1] = p_frame->p_data[0] + luma_size;
2272  p_frame->p_data[2] = p_frame->p_data[1] + chroma_b_size;
2273  p_frame->p_data[3] = p_frame->p_data[2] + chroma_r_size;
2274  }
2275  else
2276  {
2277  p_frame->p_data[0] = p_frame->p_data[1] = p_frame->p_data[2] = NULL;
2278  }
2279 
2280  p_frame->data_len[0] = luma_size;
2281  p_frame->data_len[1] = chroma_b_size;
2282  p_frame->data_len[2] = chroma_r_size;
2283  p_frame->data_len[3] = 0; //for hwdesc
2284 
2285  p_frame->video_width = width_aligned;
2286  p_frame->video_height = height_aligned;
2287 
2288  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: success: p_frame->buffer_size=%u\n", __func__,
2289  p_frame->buffer_size);
2290 
2291 END:
2292 
2293  return retval;
2294 }
2295 
2296 /*!*****************************************************************************
2297  * \brief Allocate memory for the frame buffer for encoding based on given
2298  * parameters, taking into account pic line size and extra data.
2299  * Applicable to YUV420p AVFrame only. 8 or 10 bit/pixel.
2300  * Cb/Cr size matches that of Y.
2301  *
2302  * \param[in] p_frame Pointer to a caller allocated ni_frame_t struct
2303  *
2304  * \param[in] video_width Width of the video frame
2305  * \param[in] video_height Height of the video frame
2306  * \param[in] linesize Picture line size
2307  * \param[in] alignment Allignment requirement
2308  * \param[in] extra_len Extra data size (incl. meta data). < 0 means not
2309  * to allocate any buffer (zero-copy from existing)
2310  * \param[in] alignment_2pass_wa set alignment to work with 2pass encode
2311  *
2312  * \return On success
2313  * NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS
2314  * On failure
2315  * NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
2316  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
2317  *****************************************************************************/
2318 ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_frame_buffer_alloc(ni_frame_t *p_frame, int video_width,
2319  int video_height, int linesize[],
2320  int alignment, int extra_len,
2321  bool alignment_2pass_wa)
2322 {
2323  void* p_buffer = NULL;
2324  int height_aligned;
2325  int retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
2326 
2327  if ((!p_frame) || (!linesize) || (linesize[0]<=0) || (linesize[0]>NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_LINESIZE)
2328  || (video_width>NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_WIDTH) || (video_width<=0)
2329  || (video_height>NI_MAX_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT) || (video_height<=0))
2330  {
2331  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s passed parameters are null or not supported, "
2332  "p_frame %p, linesize %p, video_width %d, video_height %d\n",
2333  __func__, p_frame, linesize, video_width, video_height);
